As the intercession of Joshua is accepted, the command is given, \93Take away the filthy garments from him,\94 and to Joshua the Angel declares, \93Behold, I have caused thine iniquity to pass from thee, and I will clothe thee with change of raiment.\94 \93So they set a fair miter upon his head, and clothed him with garments.\94 His own sins and those of his people were pardoned. Israel
149
were clothed with \93change of raiment\94\97the righteousness of Christ imputed to them. The miter placed upon Joshua's head was such as was worn by the priests and bore the inscription, \93Holiness to the Lord,\94 signifying that, notwithstanding his former transgressions, he was now qualified to minister before God in His sanctuary.
